00062 /**
00063  * Simple pluggable request/response messaging server framework.
00064  *
00065  * MessageServer implements a server with the following properties:
00066  * - It listens on a Unix socket. Socket creation and destruction is automatically handled.
00067  *   The socket is world-writable because a username/password authentication scheme is
00068  *   used to enforce security.
00069  * - Multithreaded: 1 thread per client.
00070  * - Designed for simple request/response cycles. That is, a client sends a request, and
00071  *   the server may respond with arbitrary data. The server does not respond sporadically,
00072  *   i.e. it only responds after a request.
00073  * - Requests are discrete MessageChannel array messages, not byte streams.
00074  * - Connections are authenticated. Connecting clients must send a username and password,
00075  *   which are then checked against an accounts database. The associated account is known
00076  *   throughout the entire connection life time so that it's possible to implement
00077  *   authorization features.
00078  *
00079  * MessageServer does not process messages by itself. Instead, one registers handlers
00080  * which handle message processing. This framework allows one to seperate message
00081  * handling code by function, while allowing everything to listen on the same socket and
00082  * to use a common request parsing and dispatching codebase.
00083  *
00084  * A username/password authentication scheme was chosen over a file permission scheme because
00085  * experience has shown that the latter is inadequate. For example, the web server may
00086  * consist of multiple worker processes, each running as a different user. Although ACLs
00087  * can solve this problem as well, not every platform supports ACLs by default.
00088  *
00089  * <h2>Writing handlers</h2>
00090  * Handlers must inherit from MessageServer::Handler. They may implement newClient()
00091  * and must implement processMessage().
00092  *
00093  * When a new client is accepted, MessageServer will call newClient() on all handlers.
00094  * This method accepts one argument: a common client context object. This context object
00095  * contains client-specific information, such as its file descriptor. It cannot be
00096  * extended to store more information, but it is passed to every handler anyway,
00097  * hence the word "common" in its name.
00098  * newClient() is supposed to return a handler-specific client context object for storing
00099  * its own information, or a null pointer if it doesn't need to store anything.
00100  *
00101  * When a client sends a request, MessageServer iterates through all handlers and calls
00102  * processMessage() on each one, passing it the common client context and the
00103  * handler-specific client context. processMessage() may return either true or false;
00104  * true indicates that the handler processed the message, false indicates that
00105  * it did not. Iteration stops at the first handler that returns true.
00106  * If all handlers return false, i.e. the client sent a message that no handler recognizes,
00107  * then MessageServer will close the connection with the client.
00108  *
00109  * Handlers do not need to be thread-safe as long as they only operate on data in the
00110  * context objects. MessageServer ensures that context objects are not shared with other
00111  * threads.
00112  *
00113  * <h2>Usage example</h2>
00114  * This implements a simple ping server. Every time a "ping" request is sent, the
00115  * server responds with "pong" along with the number of times it had already sent
00116  * pong to the same client in the past.
00117  *
00118  * @code
00119  *   class PingHandler: public MessageServer::Handler {
00120  *   public:
00121  *       struct MyContext: public MessageServer::ClientContext {
00122  *           int count;
00123  *           
00124  *           MyContext() {
00125  *               count = 0;
00126  *           }
00127  *       };
00128  *       
00129  *       MessageServer::ClientContextPtr newClient(MessageServer::CommonClientContext &commonContext) {
00130  *           return MessageServer::ClientContextPtr(new MyContext());
00131  *       }
00132  *       
00133  *       bool processMessage(MessageServer::CommonClientContext &commonContext,
00134  *                           MessageServer::ClientContextPtr &specificContext,
00135  *                           const vector<string> &args)
00136  *       {
00137  *           if (args[0] == "ping") {
00138  *               MyContext *myContext = (MyContext *) specificContext.get();
00139  *               commonContext.channel.write("pong", toString(specificContext->count).c_str(), NULL);
00140  *               specificContext->count++;
00141  *               return true;
00142  *           } else {
00143  *               return false;
00144  *           }
00145  *       }
00146  *   };
00147  *   
00148  *   ...
00149  *   
00150  *   MessageServer server("server.sock");
00151  *   server.addHandler(MessageServer::HandlerPtr(new PingHandler()));
00152  *   server.addHandler(MessageServer::HandlerPtr(new PingHandler()));
00153  *   server.mainLoop();
00154  * @endcode
00155  *
00156  * @ingroup Support
00157  */

00163                         1024 * 96;
00164                 #else
00165                         1024 * 64;
00166                 #endif

00177          * A common client context, containing client-specific information
00178          * used by MessageServer itself.
00179          */
00180         class CommonClientContext: public ClientContext {
00181         public:
00182                 /** The client's socket file descriptor. */
00183                 FileDescriptor fd;
00184                 
00185                 /** The channel that's associated with the client's socket. */
00186                 MessageChannel channel;
00187                 
00188                 /** The account with which the client authenticated. */
00189                 AccountPtr account;
00190                 
00191                 
00192                 CommonClientContext(FileDescriptor &theFd, AccountPtr &theAccount)
00193                         : fd(theFd), channel(theFd), account(theAccount)
00194                 { }
00195                 
00196                 /** Returns a string representation for this client context. */
00197                 string name() {
00198                         return toString(channel.filenum());
00199                 }
00200                 
00201                 /**
00202                  * Checks whether this client has all of the rights in <tt>rights</tt>. The
00203                  * client will be notified about the result of this check, by sending it a
00204                  * message.
00205                  *
00206                  * @throws SecurityException The client doesn't have one of the required rights.
00207                  * @throws SystemException Something went wrong while communicating with the client.
00208                  * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00209                  */
00210                 void requireRights(Account::Rights rights) {
00211                         if (!account->hasRights(rights)) {
00212                                 P_TRACE(2, "Security error: insufficient rights to execute this command.");
00213                                 channel.write("SecurityException", "Insufficient rights to execute this command.", NULL);
00214                                 throw SecurityException("Insufficient rights to execute this command.");
00215                         } else {
00216                                 channel.write("Passed security", NULL);
00217                         }
00218                 }
00219         };

00221         /**
00222          * An abstract message handler class.
00223          *
00224          * The methods defined in this class are allowed to throw arbitrary exceptions.
00225          * Such exceptions are caught and logged, after which the connection to the
00226          * client is closed.
00227          */
00228         class Handler {
00229         public:
00230                 virtual ~Handler() { }
00231                 
00232                 /**
00233                  * Called when a new client has connected to the MessageServer.
00234                  *
00235                  * This method is called after the client has authenticated itself.
00236                  *
00237                  * @param context Contains common client-specific information.
00238                  * @return A client context object for storing handler-specific client
00239                  *         information, or null. The default implementation returns null.
00240                  */
00241                 virtual ClientContextPtr newClient(CommonClientContext &context) {
00242                         return ClientContextPtr();
00243                 }
00244                 
00245                 /**
00246                  * Called when a client has disconnected from the MessageServer. The
00247                  * default implementation does nothing.
00248                  *
00249                  * This method is called even if processMessage() throws an exception.
00250                  * It is however not called if newClient() throws an exception.
00251                  *
00252                  * @param commonContext Contains common client-specific information.
00253                  * @param handlerSpecificContext The client context object as was returned
00254                  *     earlier by newClient().
00255                  */
00256                 virtual void clientDisconnected(MessageServer::CommonClientContext &context,
00257                                                 MessageServer::ClientContextPtr &handlerSpecificContext)
00258                 { }
00259                 
00260                 /**
00261                  * Called then a client has sent a request message.
00262                  *
00263                  * This method is called after newClient() is called.
00264                  *
00265                  * @param commonContext Contains common client-specific information.
00266                  * @param handlerSpecificContext The client context object as was returned
00267                  *     earlier by newClient().
00268                  * @param args The request message's contents.
00269                  * @return Whether this handler has processed the message. Return false
00270                  *         if the message is unrecognized.
00271                  */
00272                 virtual bool processMessage(CommonClientContext &commonContext,
00273                                             ClientContextPtr &handlerSpecificContext,
00274                                             const vector<string> &args) = 0;
00275         };

00305         /** Calls clientDisconnected() on all handlers when destroyed. */
00306         struct DisconnectEventBroadcastGuard {
00307                 vector<HandlerPtr> &handlers;
00308                 CommonClientContext &commonContext;
00309                 vector<ClientContextPtr> &handlerSpecificContexts;
00310                 
00311                 DisconnectEventBroadcastGuard(vector<HandlerPtr> &_handlers,
00312                                               CommonClientContext &_commonContext,
00313                                               vector<ClientContextPtr> &_handlerSpecificContexts)
00314                 : handlers(_handlers),
00315                   commonContext(_commonContext),
00316                   handlerSpecificContexts(_handlerSpecificContexts)
00317                 { }
00318                 
00319                 ~DisconnectEventBroadcastGuard() {
00320                         vector<HandlerPtr>::iterator handler_iter;
00321                         vector<ClientContextPtr>::iterator context_iter;
00322 
00323                         for (handler_iter = handlers.begin(), context_iter = handlerSpecificContexts.begin();
00324                              handler_iter != handlers.end();
00325                              handler_iter++, context_iter++) {
00326                                 (*handler_iter)->clientDisconnected(commonContext, *context_iter);
00327                         }
00328                 }
00329         };

00332         /**
00333          * Create a server socket and set it up for listening. This socket will
00334          * be world-writable.
00335          *
00336          * @throws RuntimeException
00337          * @throws SystemException
00338          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00339          */
00340         void startListening() {
00341                 TRACE_POINT();
00342                 int ret;
00343                 
00344                 serverFd = createUnixServer(socketFilename.c_str());
00345                 do {
00346                         ret = chmod(socketFilename.c_str(),
00347                                 S_ISVTX |
00348                                 S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR | S_IXUSR |
00349                                 S_IRGRP | S_IWGRP | S_IXGRP |
00350                                 S_IROTH | S_IWOTH | S_IXOTH);
00351                 } while (ret == -1 && errno == EINTR);
00352         }

00354         /**
00355          * Authenticate the given client and returns its account information.
00356          *
00357          * @return A smart pointer to an Account object, or NULL if authentication failed.
00358          */
00359         AccountPtr authenticate(FileDescriptor &client) {
00360                 MessageChannel channel(client);
00361                 string username, password;
00362                 MemZeroGuard passwordGuard(password);
00363                 unsigned long long timeout = loginTimeout;
00364                 
00365                 try {
00366                         channel.write("version", "1", NULL);
00367                         
00368                         try {
00369                                 if (!channel.readScalar(username, MESSAGE_SERVER_MAX_USERNAME_SIZE, &timeout)) {
00370                                         return AccountPtr();
00371                                 }
00372                         } catch (const SecurityException &) {
00373                                 channel.write("The supplied username is too long.", NULL);
00374                                 return AccountPtr();
00375                         }
00376                         
00377                         try {
00378                                 if (!channel.readScalar(password, MESSAGE_SERVER_MAX_PASSWORD_SIZE, &timeout)) {
00379                                         return AccountPtr();
00380                                 }
00381                         } catch (const SecurityException &) {
00382                                 channel.write("The supplied password is too long.", NULL);
00383                                 return AccountPtr();
00384                         }
00385                         
00386                         AccountPtr account = accountsDatabase->authenticate(username, password);
00387                         passwordGuard.zeroNow();
00388                         if (account == NULL) {
00389                                 channel.write("Invalid username or password.", NULL);
00390                                 return AccountPtr();
00391                         } else {
00392                                 channel.write("ok", NULL);
00393                                 return account;
00394                         }
00395                 } catch (const SystemException &) {
00396                         return AccountPtr();
00397                 } catch (const TimeoutException &) {
00398                         return AccountPtr();
00399                 }
00400         }

00402         void broadcastNewClientEvent(CommonClientContext &context,
00403                                      vector<ClientContextPtr> &handlerSpecificContexts) {
00404                 vector<HandlerPtr>::iterator it;
00405                 
00406                 for (it = handlers.begin(); it != handlers.end(); it++) {
00407                         handlerSpecificContexts.push_back((*it)->newClient(context));
00408                 }
00409         }
00410         
00411         bool processMessage(CommonClientContext &commonContext,
00412                             vector<ClientContextPtr> &handlerSpecificContexts,
00413                             const vector<string> &args) {
00414                 vector<HandlerPtr>::iterator handler_iter;
00415                 vector<ClientContextPtr>::iterator context_iter;
00416                 
00417                 for (handler_iter = handlers.begin(), context_iter = handlerSpecificContexts.begin();
00418                      handler_iter != handlers.end();
00419                      handler_iter++, context_iter++) {
00420                         if ((*handler_iter)->processMessage(commonContext, *context_iter, args)) {
00421                                 return true;
00422                         }
00423                 }
00424                 return false;
00425         }

00427         void processUnknownMessage(CommonClientContext &commonContext, const vector<string> &args) {
00428                 TRACE_POINT();
00429                 string name;
00430                 if (args.empty()) {
00431                         name = "(null)";
00432                 } else {
00433                         name = args[0];
00434                 }
00435                 P_TRACE(2, "A MessageServer client sent an invalid command: "
00436                         << name << " (" << args.size() << " elements)");
00437         }

00439         /**
00440          * The main function for a thread which handles a client.
00441          */
00442         void clientHandlingMainLoop(FileDescriptor &client) {
00443                 TRACE_POINT();
00444                 vector<string> args;
00445                 
00446                 P_TRACE(4, "MessageServer client thread " << (int) client << " started.");
00447                 
00448                 try {
00449                         AccountPtr account(authenticate(client));
00450                         if (account == NULL) {
00451                                 P_TRACE(4, "MessageServer client thread " << (int) client << " exited.");
00452                                 return;
00453                         }
00454                         
00455                         CommonClientContext commonContext(client, account);
00456                         vector<ClientContextPtr> handlerSpecificContexts;
00457                         broadcastNewClientEvent(commonContext, handlerSpecificContexts);
00458                         DisconnectEventBroadcastGuard dguard(handlers, commonContext, handlerSpecificContexts);
00459                         
00460                         while (!this_thread::interruption_requested()) {
00461                                 UPDATE_TRACE_POINT();
00462                                 if (!commonContext.channel.read(args)) {
00463                                         // Client closed connection.
00464                                         break;
00465                                 }
00466                                 
00467                                 P_TRACE(4, "MessageServer client " << commonContext.name() <<
00468                                         ": received message: " << toString(args));
00469                                 
00470                                 UPDATE_TRACE_POINT();
00471                                 if (!processMessage(commonContext, handlerSpecificContexts, args)) {
00472                                         processUnknownMessage(commonContext, args);
00473                                         break;
00474                                 }
00475                                 args.clear();
00476                         }
00477                         
00478                         P_TRACE(4, "MessageServer client thread " << (int) client << " exited.");
00479                         client.close();
00480                 } catch (const boost::thread_interrupted &) {
00481                         P_TRACE(2, "MessageServer client thread " << (int) client << " interrupted.");
00482                 } catch (const tracable_exception &e) {
00483                         P_TRACE(2, "An error occurred in a MessageServer client thread " << (int) client << ":\n"
00484                                 << "   message: " << toString(args) << "\n"
00485                                 << "   exception: " << e.what() << "\n"
00486                                 << "   backtrace:\n" << e.backtrace());
00487                 }
00488         }

00491         /**
00492          * Creates a new MessageServer object.
00493          * The actual server main loop is not started until you call mainLoop().
00494          *
00495          * @param socketFilename The socket filename on which this MessageServer
00496          *                       should be listening.
00497          * @param accountsDatabase An accounts database for this server, used for
00498          *                         authenticating clients.
00499          * @throws RuntimeException Something went wrong while setting up the server socket.
00500          * @throws SystemException Something went wrong while setting up the server socket.
00501          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted
00502          */
00503         MessageServer(const string &socketFilename, AccountsDatabasePtr accountsDatabase) {
00504                 this->socketFilename   = socketFilename;
00505                 this->accountsDatabase = accountsDatabase;
00506                 loginTimeout = 2000;
00507                 startListening();
00508         }

00510         ~MessageServer() {
00511                 this_thread::disable_syscall_interruption dsi;
00512                 syscalls::close(serverFd);
00513                 syscalls::unlink(socketFilename.c_str());
00514         }

00516         string getSocketFilename() const {

00520         /**
00521          * Starts the server main loop. This method will loop forever until some
00522          * other thread interrupts the calling thread, or until an exception is raised.
00523          *
00524          * @throws SystemException Unable to accept a new connection. If this is a
00525          *                         non-fatal error then you may call mainLoop() again
00526          *                         to restart the server main loop.
00527          * @throws boost::thread_interrupted The calling thread has been interrupted.
00528          */
00529         void mainLoop() {
00530                 TRACE_POINT();
00531                 while (true) {
00532                         this_thread::interruption_point();
00533                         sockaddr_un addr;
00534                         socklen_t len = sizeof(addr);
00535                         FileDescriptor fd;
00536                         
00537                         UPDATE_TRACE_POINT();
00538                         fd = syscalls::accept(serverFd, (struct sockaddr *) &addr, &len);
00539                         if (fd == -1) {
00540                                 throw SystemException("Unable to accept a new client", errno);
00541                         }
00542                         
00543                         UPDATE_TRACE_POINT();
00544                         this_thread::disable_interruption di;
00545                         this_thread::disable_syscall_interruption dsi;
00546                         
00547                         function<void ()> func(boost::bind(&MessageServer::clientHandlingMainLoop,
00548                                 this, fd));
00549                         string name = "MessageServer client thread ";
00550                         name.append(toString(fd));
00551                         threadGroup.create_thread(func, name, CLIENT_THREAD_STACK_SIZE);
00552                 }
00553         }
00554         
00555         /**
00556          * Registers a new handler.
00557          * 
00558          * @pre The main loop isn't running.
00559          */
00560         void addHandler(HandlerPtr handler) {
00561                 handlers.push_back(handler);
00562         }

00564         /**
00565          * Sets the maximum number of milliseconds that clients may spend on logging in.
00566          * Clients that take longer are disconnected.
00567          *
00568          * @pre timeout != 0
00569          * @pre The main loop isn't running.
00570          */
00571         void setLoginTimeout(unsigned long long timeout) {
00572                 assert(timeout != 0);
00573                 loginTimeout = timeout;
00574         }
